AppFooter.creator: Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

helpdesk.title: Helpdesk
helpdesk.leader: The ACDH-CH offers support for questions about digital humanities-related topics.

people.title: People
people.subtitle: Lorem ipsum
people.description: Who lived in the Christian world of the eleventh century? Where did they travel? How did they interact with the world around them? Search for empresses, monks, traders, judges, and more and get to know how their actions and perspectives connected them with each other.

places.title: Places
places.subtitle: Lorem ipsum
places.description: How were various senses of place and space conceived of and articulated in the eleventh century? What was the function of these places? To whom did they belong? What happened to them? Search for monasteries, cities, villages, and empires and discover how these diverse spaces served to connect and delimit the eleventh-century Christian world.

texts.title: Texts
texts.subtitle: Lorem ipsum
texts.description: What texts were produced in the eleventh-century Christian world? Where? By whom? For what purpose? Find out more about the letters, chronicles, and documents that were composed and copied during the eleventh century and how they acted as the material carriers of ideas that served to connect different people and places.

IndexPage.lead-in: Discover historical knowledge from the eleventh century by searching for historical persons, places, texts, and more! Use the free-text search function or navigate through our three thematic strands below.
IndexPage.title: Discover the eleventh century Christian world!

researchplatform.title: research platform
researchplatform.lead-in: Discover the eleventh century Christian world

about.title: About Us
about.lead-in: Read about the RELEVEN project and its results
about.description: Five years, fourteen project members, numerous collaborators and contributors, and mountains of data collection and analysis – what has the RELEVEN project discovered, invented, and accomplished?

relationships.title: Discover new relationships
relationships.description: Visualize the connections that scholars past and present have made between people, places, and texts.

related.title: Map the world
related.description: Examine our understanding of the geography of the eleventh century, as the inhabitants might have understood it.

viewpoints.title: Compare viewpoints
viewpoints.description: What do we think we know? See the differing and often conflicting ideas about what happened in the eleventh century.
